intro: Tithonia paneroi, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red-orange ray florets and yellow disk florets, which make it visually striking. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, also known as the sunflower family, and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in warm climates. Tithonia paneroi is often used in ornamental gardening due to its showy flowers and drought tolerance. It also serves as a valuable nectar source for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
